author: COMSOL
description: A beam splitter is used for splitting a beam of light in two. One way of making a splitter is to deposit a thin layer of metal between two glass prisms. The beam is slightly attenuated within the layer and then split into two paths. This example models the thin metal layer using a transition boundary condition, which reduces the memory requirements. Losses in the metal layer are also computed.
label: beam_splitter.mph
